column1: 10/10 - Great job identifying the manufacturing function as a suitable candidate for implementing Scrum/Sprint methodologies. Your explanation of how it could operate in this function is well thought out and detailed. Keep up the good work!
12 pts - Very complete and clear description of how scrum/sprint could operate. Great job explaining the benefits and process for the Production function. Keep up the good work!

7 pts - Some vagueness or incompleteness in discussion of fit

Comment: Good attempt at explaining the poor fit of kanban, but could be more specific to the function.

10 pts - Clear identification of business function that makes sense for kanban.

Great job identifying the Distribution function as a suitable candidate for implementing Kanban methodologies!

Rating: 10 pts

Comment: Good job on explaining how kanban could operate for the Distribution function, but there's some vagueness in the description. Keep up the good work!

5 pts - Overly general description of poor fit; not specific to this function. 

Your discussion of Scrum/Sprint's poor fit could be more specific to the function you chose. Focus on the unique aspects of that function that make it a poor fit for Scrum/Sprint.

5 pts - Selected bias is clearly relevant to this situation

Great job identifying the overconfidence bias and providing suggestions on how to avoid it. Keep up the good work!

8 pts - Right idea for definition, but some vagueness or illogic

Comment: Good attempt at defining overconfidence bias, but it could be clearer and more concise. Keep up the good work!

Rating: 10 pts

Comment: Good job on describing the solutions, but some details could be clearer. Keep up the good work!

10/10 - Great job! You provided a clear and complete description of the possible steps and actions for implementing Scrum/Sprint and Kanban methodologies in the Mighty Jaxx business functions. Keep up the good work!
